data.title: Wrong version of definition file acquired for JS project
data.body:
While testing #14328

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have a project with `lodash@3` installed as dependency
   
   ```
     "dependencies": {
       "express": "^4.14.0",
       "lodash": "^3.10.1"
     }
   ```
2. Open the project in VSCode.
3. Definition for lodash 4 is installed to `$HOME/Library/Application Support/Microsoft/TypeScript/node_modules/@types`

data.title: Disabling Typescript and Javascript formatting does not persist
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7 insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

Testing #14289 

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Disable formatting for html, json, js, and ts
2. Ensure that formatting option does not appear in the context menu for html, js, ts and js files
3. Close and open vscode

**Expected** : Formatting option does not appear in the context menu for html, js, json and ts files
**Actual**     : Formatting option does not appear for html and json files, but does appear and work as well for js and ts files.
1. Enable and Disable formatting for js and ts files

Now formatting option does not appear anymore for js and ts files

data.title: consider to generate paths with forward slashes only
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/13585:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.0
- OS Version: Win 10

Since the node ecosystem (and the glob patterns of the `outFiles` attributes) use forward slashes, we should consider to generate only forward slashes.

data.title: Update to VSCode-Textmate 2.3
data.body:
Bumps vscode-textmate to 2.3 in order to pick up this work for the markdown grammar: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-textmate/pull/26

Ran colorization tests but none seemed to need updating after this change.

Closes #14294

data.title: Control-clicking url in launch.json does bring Edge browser to foreground
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/13585:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.0
- OS Version: Win 10

Control-clicking on the url in the launch.json does not open the file in MS Edge but just makes the Edge icon blink in the Windows start bar.

I'm not sure that this is the desired behaviour: since I did not spot the blinking icon I thought that the feature is broken.

If I run the 'View license' action from the VS Code Help menu, the license file opens directly. So there must be a better way to open an url in the browser.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select text
2. Type ", ', or any other bounding character
3. Text is replaced

SublimeText (and other editors) wrap the selected text with quote or such character (both single and double quotes).

data.title: API: view management API for non-TextEditors

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Request: API support for managing non-`TextEditor` views. The functionality should support:
- show()
- hide()/close()
- move tabs/groups
- on-closed event (#12114, #13623)
- on-focus-changed event (via `onDidChangeActiveTextEditor` or new `onDidChangeActiveView`)
- presence in `visibleTextEditors` or new `visibleViews` (#6941)

In particular, `previewHtml` should return an object that provides the above functionality,

_Example use case:_ I create a preview for each open document of a certain file type. (The preview is derived from the current state of processing the document; not its contents.) Typically, the documents are all on the left column and their previews are on the right. When interacting with the document, its associated preview should become visible (without receiving focus); moving to a different column than the document itself if necessary. Without this kind of functionality, it easy for the user of my extension to become lost and confused when interacting with multiple documents.

data.title: Debugger should not collapse whitespace when presenting string values
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0
- OS Version: Windows 7

When debugging TypeScript code in a Node.js project, the debugger seem to collapse multiple sequential whitespaces to just a single space, when presenting the value of a `string` variable - this happens in both the VARIABLES panel, the WATCH panel, and in mouse-over previews, as illustrated in the screenshot.

This is highly confusing and frustrating when debugging code where whitespace in a string matters!

![vscode whitespace bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6388663/19699950/94d5095a-9af5-11e6-9c06-7a721a401070.png)

data.title: Integrated Terminal eats half of the first line when you zoom
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.0-Insiders
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch Integrated Terminal
2. Keep press `cmd +` to zoom out from zoom level `0` to `5`, you can see that the first line is not shown correctly for every zoom level.

data.title: Add support for contextmenu key

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I opened https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14323#issuecomment-256072917. There are some keybindings that other products support that we do not support. 

This [doc](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/customization/keybindings#_accepted-keys) outlines the keys that are accepted. 

Keys that are missing that I have found while making Atom and Sublime Text keymap extensions (I'd imagine there will be others) are: `context_menu`, `}`, `{`, and `+`. 

We should consider adding support for these.

data.title: Add User Setting for Highlight.js Theme used in Markdown Preview
data.body:
Issue #9136

Just submitting a PR for some work from last month. This allows users to specify which highlight.js theme they would like to use for the markdown preview. These themes are bundled in highlight.js and we already ship them.

![example-lg](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/19699682/244bb996-9aa9-11e6-8fb2-abf8686f6e50.gif)

Not all of the highlight themes work well with all vscode color themes, but I think letting users choose which theme to use is a worthwhile customization to expose.

closes #9136

data.title: Default place for extension to store cache/data?
data.body:
I'm writing an extension that downloads a few files, and I don't know where I should put it to.
- Extension Path -> Will be wiped out when updating
- Workspace -> I don't want to pollute user's workspace

Imo VSCode should give extension a default place to put cache, downloaded files, etc.

data.title: Files opened by Drag/Drop do not appear in File > Open Recent
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.1 (9e4e44c19e393803e2b05fe2323cf4ed7e36880e, 2016-10-13T16:21:53.542Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: ms-vscode.cpptools-0.9.2

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Drag drop a file to VS Code.
2. Edit it.
3. Close VS Code
4. Restart VS Code.
5. Click File > Open Recent

BUG: File opened in step 1 isn't shown.

Also, note that Open Recent does not log SAVED files; if you open a file and save it under a new name, the new name isn't recorded in the RECENT list.

data.title: Ability to display Symbols list on a Panel
data.body: I'd love to have the ability to persistently display the Symbols list for the current file on a Panel, that way I could have a split screen of my code on the left, and this on the right: Instead of having to press Cmd + Shift + O to display it like a popover every time. This is possibly related to #9418, but not exactly the same. Thanks in advance!

data.title: UX: Extension should have visual indication of globally/locally enabled

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
While testing #14288

Currently when an extension is disabled, user have no idea if it's globally or locally disabled.

The only way to figure it out is Click Enable -> See Always is greyed out -> Know the package is locally disabled. This is unintuitive.

data.title: Mac: mtime is not a good test for checking if a file is modified or not when updating <1s

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14015

Repro steps:
1. Open users settings
2. Press `Command +` to increase the zoom
3. The window zooms out every time you press `command +`. Let's say we press `cmd +` five times, the window zooms out correctly five times but take a look at the value in `settings.json`, the `window.zoom` value each time is likely `1 2 2 4 5`.
4. However, whether the value you see in the editor is correct or not, when you reload the window, Code remembers the zoom level correctly and the value in `settings.json` is correct as well. For example, after you run `cmd +` three times, the value you see in editor changes from `1` to `2` and then to `2` again, reload the window, `window.zoomLevel` is now `3`, which is correct.

It seems the only thing we don't handle perfectly is the buffer/ textDocument.

data.title: What scenarios is workbench.editor.defaultEditorGroupLayout designed to cover?
data.body:
Testing #14016

I was assuming there would be no setting that drives this and that it would just pick up the last layout used. I'm curious what the thinking was around this setting.

Consider the user that works exclusively on a vertical monitor. Whenever they open a new workspace they would have to switch the editor group layout every time, or seek out a settings that drives it. I would guess it's a pretty small number that would go and discover the setting and instead just brew in their frustration.

Given this, a more sensible default imo would be either:
- No setting, just use the last used layout
- `"workbench.editor.defaultEditorGroupLayout": "most_recent"` as the default which uses the last used layout

data.title: View menu Toggle Editor Group Layout does not show warning as Command Palette does
data.body:
Testing #14016

When there is only one editor group
- In "opened editors" view, toggle editor group button is greyed out. 
- If you try to change layout through Command palette, a warning box pops up saying `Command 'View: Toggle Editor Group Layout' is not enabled in the current context.`
- If you press `Toggle Editor Group Layout` in Menu, nothing happens.

The later two behaviors need to be consistent.

data.title: Update Extension - Error: unable to verify the first certificate
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6
- OS Version: Win 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Extension indicates to update
2. Click "Update"
3. Error message displays, "unable to verify the first certificate".

Machine is domain joined and is routed through an authenticated corporate proxy (McAfee Web Gateway).

Set the preferences as recommended, see below (removed private information)

// Place your settings in this file to overwrite the default settings
{
    "http.proxy": "http://{userid}:{password}@{host}:port",
    "http.proxyStrictSSL": false
}

Error from the developer console:

/C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:93 unable to verify the first certificate: Error: unable to verify the first certificate,    at Error (native),    at TLSSocket.<anonymous> (_tls_wrap.js:1065:38),    at emitNone (events.js:80:13),    at TLSSocket.emit (events.js:179:7),    at TLSSocket._finishInit (_tls_wrap.js:593:8),    at TLSWrap.ssl.onhandshakedone (_tls_wrap.js:425:38)

data.title: Snap of editor groups doesn't work as expected when activating another editor group by clicking on an inactive tab

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #14016
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.7.0-insider (5bafcdb3d67b29b1f4667a3f497ac05a41dde667, 2016-10-25T06:19:07.301Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-45-generic, Ubuntu 16.04
- Extensions:

| Extension | Author | Version |
| --- | --- | --- |
| EditorConfig | EditorConfig | 0.3.4 |
| lorem-ipsum | Tyriar | 1.0.0 |
| sort-lines | Tyriar | 1.1.0 |
| terminal-tabs | Tyriar | 0.0.6 |
| theme-glacier | Tyriar | 0.0.10 |
| vscode-icontheme-nomo-dark | be5invis | 1.1.5 |
| vscode-svgviewer | cssho | 1.2.0 |
| vscode-eslint | dbaeumer | 1.0.8 |
| git-project-manager | felipecaputo | 0.1.15 |
| Theme-Wombat | gerane | 0.0.2 |
| csharp | ms-vscode | 1.4.1 |
| typescript-javascript-grammar | ms-vscode | 0.0.6 |
| nova | rebornix | 0.0.5 |
| sass-indented | robinbentley | 1.1.0 |
| annotator | ryu1kn | 0.10.1 |

This happens on both vertical and horizontal editor group layouts, it's just easier to reproduce when horizontal is used.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Turn on horizontal editor group layout
2. Open files `a`, `b` in editor group 1
3. Open files `c`, `d` in editor group 2
4. Minimize the non-active editor group so that snapping is enabled
5. Click on the inactive tab in the other editor group, if snapping works as expected then try a few more times (it felt > 50% repro rate for me)

Here's what the bugged state looks like:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/19696936/2e0e0962-9a9e-11e6-807a-b15c97af14a2.png)

Note that snapping is still enabled and will snap correctly if you switch the editor groups back by click on the active tab in the inactive editor group twice.

data.title: consider to use an existing file name when generating program attribute

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/13585:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.0
- OS Version: Win 10

I had a single 'test.ts' file open in VS Code and the generated launch.json got a 'sourceMaps' and 'outFiles' attribute but the program path uses 'app.js'. This mismatch looks strange.

I suggest to use the path of the open file (if there is exactly one) or let the user pick a file (if there are more). The same could be done for js projects.
